title: Getting Daisy as a unit se we can position her properly?
body:
Like positioning is such a pain atm.
Where you have to prsition around your gardians, Daisy placement and then you have to position vs hextech, assassins, blitz, screen wide aoes etc.

So i think that when we get 3 elementalist Daisy can apear on the board for us to place where we like to, instead of me having to jam my elementalist so that she can be summoned on the only open hex/space next to em.

replies.body: I mean daisy will always show in  hex around an elementalist. If no space is open she will jump over.
Its kinda hard to give her guardian buff and be a little stread out.

> [{quoted}](name=Wickedlike,realm=EUNE,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=VEJBVd1P,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-09-04T06:33:10.657+0000)
>
> Its kinda hard to give her guardian buff and be a little stread out.

Why are you spreading out if you're going guardian?

If you want daisy to have guardian, an elementalist flanked by guardians with 2 elementalists blocked in a corner gives you a high chance of daisy getting buff.

Makes good sense to me.  Though I'm guessing it's part of the synergy randomness that Riot actually likes... Phantom, Imperial, Noble, etc. etc. all have an inherent element of RNG.  I don't see that aspect going anywhere unless their entire philosophy on TFT changes.
